analysis.raw_content:
Based on the photocopied page from this city planning technical manual, I can extract the following information with absolute precision:

**Figure Title:**
Fig 8 Entry feature with 2nd floor above

**Technical Specifications and Rules:**

**Note 1 (Top right box):**
"The 2nd floor over a vaulted entry will count as usual. Therefore, the area will count three times toward gross floor area."

**Note 2 (Right side):**
"If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway the area will be counted as follows:"

**Bullet Points under Note 2:**
• "In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the area that counts."

• "The area is measured to the outside material of the entryway feature."

• "The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area."

**Diagram Labels:**
- Isometric View
- Side Elevation  
- Porch Floor Plan
- "Height" (with measurement arrows)
- "Grade" 
- "Intersection of front facade and underside or bottom of 2nd floor"
- "Top of 2nd floor"
- "Bottom of 2nd floor"
- "Outline of entryway floor area that counts TWICE if entryway is vaulted"

**Page Number:**
13

The page contains three architectural drawings (isometric view, side elevation, and porch floor plan) illustrating the measurement and calculation rules for vaulted entryways in relation to gross floor area calculations.
